overview: Performance is a flexible program tailored to meet your musical interests, skills and career pathways. This major centres on the study of a chosen instrument or voice to develop the skills expected of a performing artist.
Students hone music performance and applied music skills alongside historical, contextual and theoretical learning.

All students take Practical Music 1 and 2 in Year 1. From Year 2, students may continue in the Practical Music or Performance stream, which provide more demanding and specialised training in individual and ensemble performance.

Structure: 225 credit points
To obtain a major in Performance students will need to complete:

150 credit points of core subjects including
50 credit points of Level 1 Performance core subjects
50 credit points of Level 2 subjects including
25 credit points of Level 2 Performance core subjects
25 credit points of Level 2 Practical Music stream or 25 credit points of Level 2 Performance stream

25 credit points of Level 3 Performance core subjects
25 credit points of Level 3 Practical Music stream or 25 credit points of Level 3 Performance stream

Transfer Major Rules:: Students may apply to transfer into the Performance Major from the Performance (ANAM) Major.

To transfer to Performance Major Year 2 students must:
complete all Level 1 core subjects in the Performance (ANAM) Major; and
have permission of the coordinator.
complete all Level 1 core subjects in the Performance (ANAM) Major; and

To transfer to Performance Major Year 3 students must:
complete all Level 2 core subjects in the Performance (ANAM) Major; and
have permission of the coordinator.
complete all Level 2 core subjects in the Performance (ANAM) Major; and
complete all Level 1 core subjects in the Performance (ANAM) Major; and
complete all Level 2 core subjects in the Performance (ANAM) Major; and
